resources.string:
The Vanderbilt Mobile Application Team (or VMAT for short) is committed to bringing high quality mobile applications to Vanderbilt University (Nashville, TN, USA). We encourage all those interested in learning mobile development to join our group. All of our work is open source, and can be found at http://code.google.com/p/vuphone. We are highly committed to developing quality practical applications in a timely manner, and the open source, interconnected nature of our development process allows an advancement in one application to produce positive effects in many others.
Additionally, our work has multiple implications above and beyond general purpose mobile applications to improve quality of life at Vanderbilt. Many of our projects transform into cutting edge research work as students progress towards a research track. On top of research potential, our group trains multiple students in advanced mobile development, allowing Vanderbilt to have a ready pool of capable developers for various special purpose projects. This group of talented individuals helps to increase Vanderbilt\'s technological advancement and web + mobile presence.
We currently work with the iPhone and Android platforms, but are always willing to work with new platforms.
If you are interested in programming for a particular platform, we would be more than happy to have you join our group, and we would help you succeed in any way possible.
Please contact any of the Faculty Leaders listed on this application if you are interested.
